title: Conspiracy theorists in court over false Brigitte Macron transgender claim
subhead: Ten people are accused of spreading a conspiracy theory online that claims the French president's wife was born a man. In court, they defended what they called their right to 'satire' − and said celebrities should have a thicker skin.

title: Dr. Péchier serial poisoning trial: Former colleagues express remorse as evidence mounts
subhead: Dr. Frédéric Péchier, who stands accused of 30 poisonings, continues to proclaim his innocence, though he acknowledged that nine patients were poisoned. His ex-colleagues, speaking from the witness stand, shared a common regret: that, over a decade, they had not suspected anything.

title: A year after deadly floods, Valencia's residents still angry at authorities' failures
subhead: The unprecedented torrential rains that struck the Valencia region on October 29, 2024 have left deep scars among the local population.

subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

title: 'You can see poverty spreading': France's welfare services confront growing hardship
subhead: Around France, agents of the CAF, a government body that provides welfare benefits, deal with difficult situations as social precarity increases.

title: Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.
